name: Dinner Tonight: Simple White Bean and Pesto Soup
description: Barbara Kafka never fails. Her recipes may be confusing—combining odd ingredients with peculiar cooking methods—but I've never completed a recipe of hers that didn't ultimately awe me. That's especially true for this recipe from Soup: A Way of Life, where there are so few ingredients, you'll wonder whether it will hold together at all. Yet, after the five minutes it takes to cook, you'll be greeted by a bowl of warming and fragrant soup, perfumed with basil and with surprising amount of depth.
recipeIngredient: 1 bunches basil, leaves rinsed and dried
4 cups cooked white beans, about 2 19-ounce cans drained and rinsed

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the chicken stock into a pot. Add the beans and turn the heat to medium-high. When it comes to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low and add 1 heaping tablespoon of the pesto, the Parmesan cheese, and a few cracks of black pepper. Simmer for about a minute. Taste and season with salt to taste.
